Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: LaurieandSpike H
Reviews.Content: The sahara is very nice, good rates, good location, all you need to make your stay in ocean city awsome !!! We stayed in the back tower, 1st floor and it was close to every thing we needed. The pools were clean, the sahara cafe food was good , its located right behind a shopping plaza which was great, it was our first time staying there, and will stay there when we go back in 2013!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Juanita J
Reviews.Content: This is the third time staying here. I agree with from Scranton, nothing fancy, but fine for the price you pay. Food was great in the cafe, and pool was nice and clean with lots of space and rooms were clean. Staff very accommodating and friendly

Reviews.Title: “From Waynesburg pa”
Reviews.Author: trissa r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shara Motel just recently the motel was clean,the location was ok, the internet sucked we couldnt connect to the wi fi from our room. We had a wonderful housekeeper Carol who woud do anything for you.Thank you Carol. The sheets were clean the beds were only doulbe beds.The towels could have been bigger. The motel is nothing fancy but it was cheap. I would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Quick Jaunt to OC on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: tiffylynn
Reviews.Content: Went to OC for our 10 year wedding anniversary over Labor Day. It was my husband, our 3 kids and myself. The room slept 5. Beds are only double beds, was not provided a roll-out, nor did we ask for it. We wanted a place that was cheap and that is exactly what the Sahara Motel is, cheap. My husband told me to spend the extra money next time. The room was clean, but had a smell to it. It is one of the older hotels in OC and it shows its age, needs updated. The room doesn't provide the basic essentials, no tissues, no shampoo/conditioner/lotion, no hand towels, so bring your own. Bath towels are small, not the oversized ones. Housekeeping left clean towels and wash cloths outside our door when we had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. Overall, it provided us with a place to sleep, which is what we wanted. It is centrally located to area attractions, which was nice!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Value"”
Reviews.Author: JRos0729
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here with various family members and friends for many years. It is affordable and clean and a great location. We have stayed in the tower and ocean front/view rooms- like them all. Cafe has great breakfast! This place is one of the few affordable motels still left on the boardwalk. Hope it stays that way! Say "Hi" to Carole the housekeeper, she was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: Karin G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the tower building. The room was neat and clean upon arrival, and the A/C unit was freezing cold. We had to turn it off at times because it was that cold.I would rather it be too cold, than too hot though. The room served it's purpose. A place to shower and rest. The pool was nice and clean to. There was a smell to the room, but it wasn't that much of an issue. Our housekeeper Carol was the best!! She gave us directions and answered any questions I had about OC MD. It was a while since I had been there. It was just a few short steps from the beach, and there was fresh water to rinse off after you were finished. The cafe was very good. The service and food was great. I would rather pay less for the room, and shop more. The only problem I had were the wifi. I would have loved to surf the net in the evenings after a long day. I could not get a connection for any length of time. I couldn't get online. I am thinking about booking this place for next summer, and trying an ocean front room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: JDi509
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the off-boardwalk building to save some money. This is a great value. Prices are well below many of the other hotels in Ocean City in season, and the place was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly, and we enjoyed our stay. We come for the beach attractions and don't need a 5 star hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is....”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgainRt66
Reviews.Content: Listen...do you go to the beach for the hotel? If you do...book the Hilton...but if you just want a clean bed and a shower, book the Sahara. My husband & I have stayed here twice now (2nd floor in the oceanfront buliding). The rooms are average with small bathroom, service is friendly , cafe has great breakfast, and the prices are very reasonable. Housekeeping could do a little better, but our bed was clean & comfy, towels were fresh & clean everyday....we didn't see any bugs. If you cannot do stairs, book first floor in the ocean front building because there is no elevator. You can't beat the location or the view ! We have heard mixed opinions on the Sahara, but we have had only good experiences with them so far. On this trip we also heard great things about The Spinnaker Hotel next door...we will try it next year...to be cont........

Reviews.Title: “aug. getaway”
Reviews.Author: joann v
Reviews.Content: we had an efficicny room everything was great, except the bath room too small, can be alittle more updated. being right on the beach was nice. would come again. the location was excellent near eveerything. beach was very clean cafe was wonderful enjoyed the food and seervice

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Donna H
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel/motel, so you won't get any frills here. We only stayed one night, and you are at the beach, so you won't be in the room long. It was clean, but the room did have a 'armpit-like' smell when we first walked in. It may have been from the air conditioner. There was a stain on my bed sheet, but you could tell it was old and the sheets had been washed... it would be nice if they threw those out. The bathroom was clean and updated with new tiles in the shower; tub and sink a nice blue, but overall was clean. Can't complain too much for the price, and a decent location, right off the boardwalk, so we didn't have to drive. Ice machine costs 25 cents, but you can fill up a small 6pack type cooler for about 50 cents. They have a cafe, which we didn't go to, but had a long line for breakfast, so it must have been decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: Happylady345
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Sahara in OC. Great location, price and friendly staff. Thanks, Barbara, for a nice clean room, and your pleasant greetings. The nights were quiet, the air conditioning worked well and there was no musty smell. What more could you want at the shore. You could even eat in the restaurant in the tower building. Great food and prices. Beware portions are large,but never fear, you can take leftovers back to put in frig for later time.Then you can reheat if you have to in microwave. All in all we enjoyed are stay and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “no don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ocdreaming2005
Reviews.Content: If you are disabled there are no elevators and about 25 steps to gert to the thrid floor. For what we paid for this room it was a bad deal. 1) not disablity friendly 2) had to pay for ice 3) nothing in the room EX: coffee pot, mini fridge, our littler frezzer did not work put a soda bottle of water in there to freez and take to the beach the next day was not even pieces of ice 4) all you got was 4 tiny bars of soap, 5) paid over 450.00 for two nights NOT WORTH IT........... one good thing about the room was we had oceanfront and the view was nice. WILL NOT STAY THERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach...”
Reviews.Author: Jojoandnikki
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Sahara for years and never had any problems. During my last stay here, though, while packing to leave, we found a huge cockroach. We complained, but the motel had nothing to offer except that they would check it out. Won't ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “spider in my childrens bed”
Reviews.Author: Lswilliams32
Reviews.Content: On August 2012 I took my children to ocean city for the first time our last vacation for the summer. We stayed at the Sahara motel on 19th st . The motel is very out dated for the prices they charge. The people above us ran and bumped all day and night. But the worse part bout the trip was that there was a black spider in my childrens bed. My son went to pull the blanket up to look for something. Then he seen something black and he touched it come to find out it was a spuder.My children freaked out. It ruined their whole experience of ocean city. When I checked out I asked for a complaint paper I wrote down about the spider and the people above us the. The lady just said thats awful. She didnt say let me get the manager let's go to your room before you check out nothing. Just we have your money so it doesnt matter. My children was still talking bout the spider on the way home so I called the motel manager and all he said was ok. Wow I couldnt believe it not is your children ok ,we are sorry, he said nothing like that just ok. Not how can we accommodate you and your children, your stay is on us. he said none of that. My childrens first and last time in ocean city , they say they dont ever want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Room was just ok”
Reviews.Author: heather52970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sahara for 2 nighs. The location is excellent. We had an oceanview room. There were no fitted sheets on the bed, they just used flat sheets. When I went to use the microwave it obviously hadn't been cleaned recently there was old food particles laying on the tray. The bathroom was very small and all they provided for you is a bar of soap. We had to call the front desk for towels and washcloths on our second day there, the housekeeper didn't leave us any. The staff were very friendly at the office and the view was very nice but don't think we will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: las530
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed at the Spinnaker next door to the Sahara but we decided to stay an extra night and the Spinnaker did not have a room available so we booked our last night at the Sahara. HUGE mistake!!! They put us in room 316, side ocean view. Third floor, NO Elevator to start. But the absolute worst was the smell that you got hit with as soon as you opened the door! Not sure if there was a dead body buried in this room or some 90 year old cheese! Opened the balcony door most of the time that we were in the room just to breath. But with the crappy little window unit air conditioner with a inch of filth & dust doesn't cool these rooms, we were quite WARM. The refrigerator was not plugged in and the freezer section was full of stinky old water. The beds were very uncomfortable. The linens on the bed were about 50 years old. If we were staying for more then 1 night I would of insisted on a refund and ran. Weren't expecting the Hilton for the price but the Alley would have been cleaner and more comfortable. Look at the Spinnaker next door if you want a reasonable, clean, comfortable up to date hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Is an OK motel”
Reviews.Author: Shay B
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly and helpful that's a plus, location is excellent, rooms are a comfortable size BUT the bathroom are small and need upgrading (pipes seem a lil bit clogged up) the room was clean even though I found a hairpin and 5cents hidden by the bedspread and it smelled a lil bit musty, the only big dissapointment for me was that there is no vanity or counter for makeup and hair products, you must set your stuff on the dresser and there is a mirror above it but lighting is poor but overall our stay was pretty good, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pama72
Reviews.Content: Price reasonable!! Staff and maids very friendly..flatscreen tv..the view speaks for itself...it's not chic but how much do u actually spend in your room while on vacation??? The cafe has an excellent breakfast but get there early!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: blkdiva007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel while celebrating my birthday, with my family and the first room we checked out was a mess it looked like someone was still in the room, we where immediately given a new room with a side view of the oceanfront. This is a motel not a hotel and Sahara needs to spend some money on new mattresses and new A/C's, pillows. The staff where doing there bes with what they had to work with but I would look into staying and renting a townhouse, condo on my next visit to Ocean City. Sahara Motel is a short stay joint no extras. Easy check in and out just not up to my standard while on vacation with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cheerymom806
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our second year staying at Sahara. We stayed in the Tower Building, which is the only one of the Sahara buildings with an elevator. The Sahara Cafe (also highly recommended) is conveniently right below and so is one of the two swimming pools. The rooms are not fancy, so if you are looking for a lot of frills, this is not the place for you. However, if you are looking for a decent price place at a great location with a good, clean room, this is the best place in OC! The beds are comfy, the towels were a little scratchy but nothing that bothered us that much. The room has a small fridge with a little freezer compartment and a microwave. A/C worked great, water pressure was great and we had no problem with having enough hot water. The maid came daily. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone who just wants a good clean place to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Economical”
Reviews.Author: Chelsi203
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at the Sahara. They were very accomadating. The room was clean, which was very important to us. However, bring your own toiletries. The only thing provided was little soaps. We arrived early and went to check in. The staff was very friendly and gave us a parking pass so that we could park and access the beach. This is not the Hilton but if you want a clean place to stay without all the luxuries, this is definitely the place to go. Enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Befuddled by ratings on this one?”
Reviews.Author: Rose C
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this motel because of the good ratings. After actually staying at this motel this past weekend and from actually experiencing the stay.... we are surprised at the ratings. This motel was very outdated. .... when we first opened the door.....the room smelled like body order. We had to use air fresheners to try to get rid of the smell but did not help. The beds were bouncy and the pillows were like sleeping on a bag full of tissue paper. I did not trust sleeping on the sheets and the spreads did not look clean you just get a feeling the mattresses were disgusting. The room just gave you a dirty feeling. The refrigerator temperature knob was missing. They did not provide coffee at all in your room or at the small motel lobby. TheTV was tiny and outdated and the table and chair set in your room was very tiny. You could tell the bathroom towels were cheap and they were small. The cold water handle in the shower was broken so you could get burned by the hot water if not careful. Overall the bathroom appeared to be dirty. We stayed for the sake of saving money but it was not worth if you do not be comfortable were you stay. I am complaining so much because this room was just nasty. I would not recommend this motel for people who want to save money. Our outside chairs were stolen by our neighbor guest. The pools were dirty......and the list goes on. Do not stay if you can find something better. This review is based on my own experience and my genuine opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to judge...”
Reviews.Author: Ewelch2
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly. The room was spacious and very clean. For the money it would apear to be a good value. The clientele over all was very low rent. Noisy, drunken folks. Below me was a family gathering, one of whom was blaring his car stereo at the hotel and yelling in the parking lot. To the credit of the manager, he dealt with it promptly when I called. The city overall was a "spring break" type place - screaming motocycles, drunken loud kids out all night. I have a hard time judging this place - good hotel, bad place to be I guess. In future if I need a place to stay for a night heading down the coast, I'd choose Bethany Beach or Fenwick Is., DE a bit further north. I'd rate this hotel poor, but they really don't deserve that rating for where they are.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: DZsmom
Reviews.Content: After researching at least 10 hotels in Ocean City, all on-the-beach locations, I chose the Sahara mostly for the price which is excellent, and the reviews. I had a 3rd floor room and beware, there are no elevators in the oceanfront building so be prepared for the stairs. The Sahara is clean, well run and in a great location on the boardwalk and beach. The view from the oceanfront room is incredible, and I loved sitting on my private balcony watching the ocean and all of the activity up and down the boardwalk. And while the boardwalk was active, once inside the room, all was quiet no matter what time of the day or night. I stayed there with a friend for several days and the only general comment would be to ask the hotel to add some shelving or storage to the sink/bathroom area. The hotel is within walking distance to several restaurants and shops on and off the boardwalk and if you don't feel like walking you can ride the tram, although there is a cost for it. All in all, you can't go wrong with the Sahara. If you are just looking for a nice, clean place with few frills, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for ocean view.”
Reviews.Author: tmjz28
Reviews.Content: Second year at Sahara motel Towers in Ocean City. Two issues this year. It was hot as blazes and room a/c not very cool. Had a good a/c unit when we arrived, but made a lot of noise. We opted to have it replaced. Big mistake. The replacement was only half as cool as the noisy one. Second issue was elevator. It is very slow and when it got extremely hot it stopped altogether. Had to take stairs a few times to get things done. Will be back next year. Still love this place for the money. Hotels across the street on ocean side are a $100 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you just need a place to crash for a night or 2”
Reviews.Author: Abby L
Reviews.Content: I remember staying at sahara many years ago while in HS and college with friends, because of the good rates. Looked it up again this summer, and still the best deal. we stayed one night July 8, 2012. another couple and us and our 1 year old. great Location for the money. They called us when the room was ready (we got there at 1030 am, they called by noon) Didn't remember the walk down to the end of the boardwalk being that long, but I guess the age thing is creeping up on us. Have a spigot for rinsing off right at the boardwalk. Pools were great, other families with small children in them. Every thing was clean when we got there. Air works great. Beds not so great, but we were so tired it didnt matter. Drains were slow to go down, but I almost expect that at any older beachy location. I would stay again next summer!

Reviews.Title: “On the beach at half the price”
Reviews.Author: michygal05
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by accident after reading a review for another hotel that was not supposedly a great place to stay. This hotel is part of a chain called Best hotels ...www.bestmotels.com The others Beachmark, Executive and Tides didnt seem as great of a location at the Sahara. It is literally one block from the beach and some of the units are right on the boardwalk ( I think they are a bit pricer though!) The rates vary from $129-$149 a nite for a standard room ( two double beds, A/C and an antiquated TV but hey, it works. The Sahara cafe on the property makes the BEST breakfast and you cant beat the price!We stayed in the Tower which has the pool and cafe attached to it. I think it is your best bet. The West bldg is nice but I think it is more for families and a bit more noisy. The hotel staff is super nice and friendly although they could use a bit more knowledge about surrounding restaurants and things to do. The rooms are clean and our housekeeper Joyce was such a nice cute older woman with a great attitude. She seemed to love her job and was good at as well. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “I paid $250...for this...”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: Went to ocean city on my honeymoon and this hotel turned what should have been a special trip into a nightmare. I have learned my lesson not to book a hotel before I see it in OC. I tried to find somewhere decent but not too expensive but I didn't want a hole in the wall either. So I figured $250 a night should get me somewhere decent to stay...wrong. When we arrived we walked in and it felt so humid in the room it was like someone turned a sprinkler on to the " mist" setting. The mirror was foggy and dripping with water. The curtain to the window was open and everyone on the boardwalk could see in so I decided to shut it. The rod to the curtain fell off in my hand. I then tried to shut it by hand and the curtain just fell off of the slider. So I call down to the front desk where they were going to send someone up. In the meantime my wife used the bathroom and then called me back. I walked back to see her holding the handle to the toilet in her hand. I called the front desk again and the person working gave us a different room. This was the handicapped room. The room was a lot better but the walls were dirty the sheets were dirty and we founds bugs in the morning. The bathroom does not have a curtain it has frosted glass so when you go to the bathroom everyone can see. I got so upset I called the morning after our arrival and spoke with the manager and he at first refused to give any kind of refund. He did eventually give us one day out of 3 back which would have been great except we only stayed one night. We right away got on the phone when we woke up and booked another room. We went with the Carousel hotel which compared to the Sahara was heaven. Avoid this place like the plague!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lauren E
Reviews.Content: This motel has the most wonderful staff! Gloria was the sweetest maid and went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our stay! I would definitely recommend this hotel. You cannot beat the location and the cafe has awesome food!

Reviews.Title: “we love the Sahara and the house keeper Carole!”
Reviews.Author: DoodlebugsMom2001
Reviews.Content: we just got home back to WV after spending 7 nights and watching the OC air show. We ALWAYS stay at the Sahara every year. This year we stayed a bit longer and enjoyed every minute of it, we hated to leave! We just had 1 night with some young people partying but the night watchman came over and quietened them down quickly! Our house keeper Carole on the 3rd floor in the elevator building was wonderful! She bent over backwards to make us comfortable and we have adopted her into our family! Plenty of towels,extra blankets and a roll away bed for one of my kids came quickly! We had offers of helping unpacking our stuff and offers to help load up when leaving. Reasonable rates, clean room and extra friendly/helpful staff makes our family vacation extra special. Will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location or price”
Reviews.Author: carannbalto
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy motel but the rooms were clean, the pool was well maintained. The location was great - didn't have to drive to get to anything. My only complaint were the beds - felt like I was sleeping on a trampoline!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: Acstylist09
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after a horrible one night at a hotel on the bay side. The staff was wonderful and the pricing was great! I loved being able to sit on the porch and see the board walk!

Reviews.Title: “Graet Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Rick21234
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the south tower building and found it to be clean. The people from the front desk to restaurant were very friendly. The night security guy was very pleasant and personable when it came time to tell us to lower our volume. Can't beat the location, just a few steps from Pizza, beer, and beach.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: DianeS5254
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, the staff was great and so friendly and the room was so comfy and relaxing, we are reserving our room again for this year....can not wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but good location, clean, well-run”
Reviews.Author: DonSchenck
Reviews.Content: We visited in late August, 2011 for a few nights. A balcony on the boardwalk for $159 a night? I am there! The room was clean, the motel seemed to be well-run, the folks were friendly, and parking was fine. Very good location. A plus, their associated diner is good, fun and decently-priced. We WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates and very clean”
Reviews.Author: wv56
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there for 20 years. Rooms are very clean and reasonable rates for OC. Ocean front rooms have terrific view and are much cheaper than any we have found. Location foe walking is great, and the beach in front of the hotel is very large. Only problem this year was scratchy towels. Complained when checking out and manager was to follow up-said maids were using too much bleach???

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable.....Nice Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachmom0508
Reviews.Content: After cancelling our first reservations at "The Ambassodor Inn" because of bad reviews about 3 weeks before, we were lucky to get 2 rooms at the Sahara. Friends stayed there and they liked it, and the reviews were pretty good. We started out with 2 separate rooms in the tower building which was across the street from the boardwalk. We were looking for adjoining rooms but at such late notice we weren't surprised that we couldn't get them. It was my husband & I, our 2 girls (6&3), and my mom and dad. When we got there, we were able to get 2 rooms (about 6 rooms apart) in the poolside building which was right behind the ocean front building, with a great pool right below us. So we didn't have to walk across the road to get to the boardwalk. They said the one room would have no veiw, but we were very happy with it because it was at the front of the building and we had extra railing space to hang our towels and the way the steps were we had almost a private balcony. We were on the 3rd floor and unfortunately did not have an elevator (my fault for not asking first, the tower building did have one). The staff was very friendly, the rooms were nice and cozy. The wifi worked great!!!! We tried out both pools and we loved them both. And the cafe was excellent also!!!! CONS: Cable blinked out a couple times but came back in a few minutes, and we had a big bright yellow light right outside our room (309) that came in around the curtains so our room was not completely dark at night. The only thing i would have liked better was if they had queen beds instead of double. After sleeping in a king bed at home, having to share a double was not comfy. I did love their pillows though. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel”
Reviews.Author: lazydays19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend of his birthday. The people at the front desk are very friendly. We stayed in the tower building overlooking the pool. We could see the ocean waves right from our window. We stayed in room 441. The room was very clean and spacious. The bathroom was also very clean no mold or anything. The room was overall in great condition. It has a tv, microwave, and fridge. It was very quiet all around us. Its in a perfect place just a street away from the boardwalk. I looked up many hotels to stay in and i'm so glad we chose this one we didn't have one bad experience here so lucky. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone especially if your trying to find a pretty cheap hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Gadget_Guy74
Reviews.Content: Wi-fi refused to connect, front desk was rude & hung up on me after 2nd call to say the code given wasn't working, "well that's what it is".. 3 of us tried on 3 different devices,..none connected, room was cramped and humid/damp, AC off.. bathroom door didn't close all the way, didn't fit the frame correctly and therefore could not lock in case of zombie invasion,.., there was hole drilled thru a small divider wall in the corner for the 'closet' with an extension cord running through it to the wide open and warm fridge (doubt this set up would pass safety codes), beds were bouncy not firm, jagged egded holes drilled in the metal door frame for the deadbolt, loose and rattly fit, literally have to slam doors to shut them (not just us). Best thing about it was the strong AC unit, bouncy beds (I happen to like soft, you won't like beds if you need a firm mattress) and the small tv at least worked. Oh and the welcome card or guest card was crumpled and used not fresh and new. Bathroom by the way is very narrow, can not extend arms all the way out before touching both walls.. And was very boring and minimalist, all white, 2 towels, no hooks to hang anything, only room for only 1 toiletry bag on the toilet back. Also my room's view happened to be looking out into the stairs going upstairs. Can't comment on the pool didn't use it. I took pics and may post later.

Reviews.Title: “What to do? We love this place.”
Reviews.Author: jwpros10
Reviews.Content: This is to the Sahara Hotel: What do I need to do to reschedule for later in the week when I can't even get a hold of any one? We are to arive on 8-29-11 but need to move it to 8-31-11.And I hope they understand it's do to mother nature. I really hope they don't keep our deposit and recharge us for moving it to later in the week. I understand the problems there but I can't even find a web page for them to let them know via email. Well I guess I'll call tomorrow and hope everything is ok. No calling today,they are closed. Other then this issue we love the place and have been going here for the last 12 years for our anniversary and lived threw other hurricanes and we still love this place.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: suzyshop
Reviews.Content: If you want a fairlycheap place to stay,i suggest you try the Sahara motel.We've stayed there twice so far.Both times the rooms were clean,and we had no problems.The pools were adequate,the only drawback was the distance to the heart of the boardwalk.We had a great time,i'm already planning our next vacation in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and would definetly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Molly G
Reviews.Content: We took a 4 day trip down to Ocean City for a little summer getaway. There were 3 of us and we stayed in the Tower building. The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were really soft and we definetly will ask for queens next time. They could use a little updating but we didn't spend a whole lot of time in there. The AC was cold, the fridge was sufficient and the microwave worked. We were about a block from the beach and you can see the boardwalk from the parking lot. There was beach access right there at the end of the street. They let us check in early since our room was ready. They have 2 pools but they close at 8pm and we happen to be later swimmers so we only used the one by the cafe. Which by the way had the best breakfasts and was packed everyday! This happened to be one of the best meals we had the whole time we were there. Lots of food for the price. They're only open for breakfast and lunch though. We are already planning our trip for next year and hope to stay at the Saraha Motel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cheerymom806
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sahara's Tower Building, which has a pool and Cafe on site. The room was very clean, the maid came every day and even though we were one block back from the beach, we had an awesome view from our balcony (we were 4th floor, all the way at the end). Our girls, ages 11 and 8, LOVED the pool. It ranged from 3-5 ft. deep which was perfect for them. I cannot say enough good things about the Sahara Cafe! The staff was very friendly, the food was really good (homemade food) and the portions were very generous. The price was great, we went down for the early bird special between 7-8 am and got two eggs, two strips of bacon (or sausage) and two LARGE pancakes for $3.99! I ended up splitting one with my 8 yr. old cause I couldn't eat it all myself! The room had a small fridge with a small freezer compartment and a small microwave. Now, I will say if you're looking for a high end type room, this is not for you, but if you just want a good, clean place to stay, you will not be disappointed. Also, the tower building has a parking lot right below and an elevator. It is close to the boardwalk and beach, but at the same time, I noticed that in the evening/night hours when the boardwalk is buzzing with people, it was less crowded up at this end than down around the lower streets. We appreciated that it was quiet when we were ready for bed. The only cons I can even speak of would be the pillow wasn't very comfortable, (although the bed was comfortable), and the washcloths and towels were a little rough. Overall, it is a great place though. We felt very comfortable here and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great motel, will be going back, cafe was excellent. from check in to checkout everyone was great.”
Reviews.Author: patty2024
Reviews.Content: Check in made us feel very welcome. Room was clean and the ladies who took care of the rooms very polite and did their jobs well. Pool was very clean and clear. The Sahara Cafe was fabulous, wonderful breakfast and lunch. This motel will not disappoint,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Delighted910
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long weekend. This was the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in in Ocean City. I was totally impressed. The pools were great and the Cafe had great breakfast. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: Hhnrs04
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice motel. Didn't want for anything (except maybe coffeepot in room). Rooms looked to be recently done over in some areas and the grounds are very nice and well kept. Cafe is a real plus. Will probably stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: misscaryn22
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! the people where friendly and nice and they let us check in early. The room was big and clean. the maids were friendly also. Close to beach and boardwalk and there was two pools. the only thing i didnt like was the fact it said we all get a bacony for two but we didnt have one so we has to stand in the space we had. would def recommend to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: BeachFamily1990
Reviews.Content: Great location and price! My family and I stayed for the Ocean City Air Show this year. This is a prime spot to watch the air show from your balcony. You do have a private balcony which is nice. The room was spotless and the housekeeping staff was very friendly and attentive. We stayed for 3 nights and found it be very quiet even with it's boardwalk location. We would highly recommend The Sahara to anyone seeking a value and a clean room with a fantastic location. They also have a Cafe' that serves breakfast and lunch, we enjoyed their food very much. One negative, only (1) parking space for each room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not clean at all!”
Reviews.Author: Bearcub04
Reviews.Content: Rooms need a good cleaning. The tubs don't drain very good so all the stuff you wash off floats around your feet. Everyone elses hair all over the bathroom. Smells like mold and mildew. We had 2 rooms and the one had ants that crawled on all of our bathroom stuff. We made the best of it but I could not wait to get home in my clean bathroom and bed. It's cheap but it's not even worth that price, maybe they should put it down to 50 bucks a night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BBear64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July of 2010 and chose it primarily for the value as well as location. Check-in was a breeze and the office and service staff at the Sahara were very friendly. We had some issues with the phone not working in our room and they sent some one immediately to attend to the problem. The room was adequate in size...we had a room in the pool building on the 1st floor and enjoyed the patio sitting area outside our door. The room was set up a little oddly and the AC was at the rear of the room and at times we had to have it at full blast in order to get air to the front living area of the room. The bathroom was super small and had no ventilation fan, but water pressure was fine. When we arrived the portable fridge was not plugged in, so we had to wait for awhile before we could use it to keep things cool and the microwave while it worked alright is rather outdated. The location was great...about a two minute walk to the Boardwalk & beach and absolutely loved the quietness of this end of the Boardwalk. Overall had a very pleasant experience at the Sahara!

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: brandi2446
Reviews.Content: My family and I go to Ocean City every year. We had stayed at the Sahara Motel more than once and the price was reasonable so we decided to stay there again. When we walked in our room on the first day and went out to the balcony, we noticed that there was a good amount of sand and cigarette butts on the balcony. There was so much sand that my 3 year old could have built a sand castle on our balcony. It looked like someone had not cleaned up the balcony for weeks. We called down to the office and someone came up and swept it off. We had the worst cleaning lady ever. We had to ask for towels daily. And in the mornings when the cleaning lady would show up, she would ask us to bring her the trash and dirty towels. The one day we came back from breakfast, we noticed that the room had not been cleaned (vacuumed, trash taken out). I had a 2 year old at the time and between the sand and crumbs the room needed to be vacuumed every day. I called down to the office and they said they were going to call our cleaning lady. When the cleaning lady called back she told me that she was about to leave for the day and that she did not have time to vacuum our room. I am not a person that expects things to be perfect but I did pay almost $200 a night for this room and I feel that the room should be vacuumed daily. The other thing that people may want to think about before staying here is that the balcony's have a cement wall in between them. So if you stay with family in the room beside you, you cannot talk to them when you are on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean rooms at a great value!”
Reviews.Author: OCMD16
Reviews.Content: Nice clean ocean view motel room right right near the boardwalk in OCMD!! Bathroom is a little small but has been recently remodeled with new tile and a brand new tube. Sink is separated from the shower allowing one person to finish getting ready while another person showers. Two newer double beds, cable TV, small refrigerator and a small microwave met our needs and should meet the needs for most vacationers as most vacationers do not spend much time in their rooms. Needed a few extra towels & wash clothes which were promptly delivered in just minutes!! My teenage niece & nephew loved the high speed internet. I love that it was FREE!! Would highly recommend this motel to anyone who wants a place to stay real close to the beachgreat value small family or group.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay except...”
Reviews.Author: stahli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Ocean City, MD for a couple's getaway and stayed at the Sahara Motel in the tower building over Labor Day weekend. The staff was very pleasant and the price was very reasonable. Upon entering our room, we noticed that while the room was very clean, it had a terrible smell, like body odor. Also, there was a whistling sound coming through the bottom of the door. I kept opening the door thinking there was a child out there with a whistle or something, but the sound would go away when the door opened. The sound of the air conditioner blocked out the whistling, and we sprayed Febreeze all over the first day, and the smell dissipated, so those things didn't bother us too much. What did bother us, was the people partying on the floor below us. They woke us up at 3:00 am screaming and hollering and laughing. Finally, at 3:30 am, I got up out of bed and called the office. The man who answered was very nice and said he had already evicted one set of guests that night, and that he would take care of it. A little while later, more yelling and someone slamming their door over and over and over again. As if to be louder because they were told to be quiet. Needless to say, we didn't get much sleep that night. I can understand that the motel cannot predict how other guests will behave, but I think after our call, they should have been keeping an eye on that room for the rest of the night. The pool was very nice and clean and had lots of lounge chairs. We were going to have a late lunch at the restaurant, but it closed at 2 pm, which we thought was kinda weird...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable room”
Reviews.Author: Sandy35
Reviews.Content: The room was as we expected. Just check the beds to make sure the linens were changed because my daughter found sand in one of the beds and had to call the front desk. We had to carry luggage up 3 flights. Oh well. That's what you pay for, just the ok room. We did not go to the Sahara Cafe because on the printed menu, on the lower left side it says "Jay and his crack staff welcome you to the Sahara Cafe". I thought that was totally inappropriate. Go to Jonah and the Whale for a wonderful buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Flyersfan090
Reviews.Content: Went to OCMD for a 3 nites getaway, didn't want to spend a fortune on a room. We've stayed here yrs ago when we took kids. Our room was clean, the shower hot and strong, it was a good value. Its location at 19th street is perfect. A half block from the beach. They cleaned our room, the air conditioner worked fine, I have nothing negative I could say. If you want fancy, you'll pay 3 times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: msolymos
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Sahara. I read some of the not so good reviews, but honestly you couldn't ask for anything more!!! The Sahara is the best deal in Ocean City. The price is right and the rooms are clean!!! It is in a great location and the restaurant has great breakfast. What more could you ask for. Yeah the bathroom may be small Blah, Blah , Blah, BUT IT IS CLEAN!!!!!!! PEOPLE !!!! This place is a no brainer. win win place!!! Go Relax Enjoy yourself!!!! Spend the other 200.00 on fun beach stuff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: LAXMOM2009
Reviews.Content: What an awesome place! My family and I are from Salisbury, MD....we decided to take a last minute vacation before our teenagers started back to school. How cool was it that we could simply travel 30 miles East to Ocean City and find such a fantastic place! We are thinking now that every vacation is going to be in our "backyard" so to speak. The Sahara Motel is truly what Ocean City is....a family type atmosphere, great price and a friendly staff. Our room was great and so was the housekeeping staff. They have it all wrapped up in a reasonable price for a family of 5! They have 2 swimming pools, a Cafe and are located right on the boards! We even took the bus system everyhwere...the bus only cost $2.00 per day! So nice to find a gem in your "backyard"!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghfan1968
Reviews.Content: my family has stayed at the sahara motel many times in the last 10 years............the location is perfect. we stay in the oceanfront rooms and love the floor to cieling glass fronts.....what a view. it has always been very clean and we have NEVER had a problem. i do not understand the bad reviews.....obviously you cannot please everyone ...maybe they had personal issues....because we have not had any problems. we choose to stay here for about 200.00 a night instead of the big hotels for 400.00 a night and spend the money we save on the boardwalk amusements which are great but the cost adds up fast. we do not think you can stay anywhere in ocean city for this rate in the summer anywhere as nice.

Reviews.Title: “nothing fancy but clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: cobeachgirl628
Reviews.Content: This was a simple room with an incredible oceanfront view. The bathrooms are small, but I was at the beach and not planning on spending a lot of time in my room or bathroom! I found everything to be quite clean, the housekeeper was very pleasant and seemed happy to work around my morning schedule. I checked in after hours and had no problems there. A nice girl named Alison who worked at the front desk suggested restaurants and activities, she was like the Chamber of Commerce. The location was the best on the boardwalk. Great cafe on the property, I forgot the name.

Reviews.Title: “very unclean”
Reviews.Author: Abesbabe23
Reviews.Content: The room smelled like mildew, the sink was clogged, and the beds were horrible. The have not been any upgrades in this motel for a very long time. The small refridgerator was extremely old and needed to be replaced. The locks on the windows did not work and the carpet was stained and worn in many places. The only plus to this motel is that it is very close to the beach - right across the street. Find another place to stay if you are looking to vacation in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice older motel”
Reviews.Author: Leonje
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay in the Tower building at the Sahara. The place isn't fancy, but it is well-maintained and very clean. My husband and I like to travel cheap, so we usually stay at the cheaper, older motels in OC. This was the nicest place we've stayed in OC so far. No crumbs or sand on the floor. No bugs. No weird stains. No mold or slime in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable. The maid came everyday and gave us new towels. The furniture and bathroom were older, but they still worked well. There are two pools. Both are relatively small and only go up to 5 ft. The little kids tended to go in the peanut shaped pool in front of the Poolside bldg, so we kept to the pool in front of the Tower bldg. The pool was clean and few people seemed to use it. The motel was quiet overall, though people did like to hang out on the walkways. On a couple of nights, we found some older people (40's - 60's) having a little party out there, but they were pretty quiet and I couldn't hear them inside the room. There was a security guard present who you could call if someone was being disruptive. The location is great - on the boardwalk, but high enough up so you don't have a lot of crowds and noise. The Sahara cafe is a great place to grab breakfast. It was very convenient - just a walk down the hall. Overall, I would definitely return there for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JoKur6207
Reviews.Content: I think this motel is great. The location is perfect -on or near the boardwalk depending on which building you are in- and it is a quiet part of the boardwalk. Every staff member I encountered was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious (the bathrooms are a little on the small side but I've found that to be the case in most OC hotels/motels that I've stayed). Overall this is one of the best places I've stayed in OC.... and for the price I think it is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: mcleodgang
Reviews.Content: We were in the Ocean front building and looks to have just been remodelled. We were very pleased with the room (bathroom is very small) but would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay at the Sahara!”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebreeder
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Sahara. We've never had one bad experience. We always opt for the oceanfront/3rd floor because we don't have to worry about young children overhead jumping around, which children naturally do. We love the private balcony to watch the sunrise, sites on the beach & ocean and ppl watch on the boardwalk. True, it's not all swanky like some of the higher end motels, but we don't live in the motel. We're either out on the beach or strolling on the boardwalk. If you wonder what the room comes with, make your list and call...the friendly staff will be more than happy to answer your questions. We're booked to stay again the end of August 2010 and can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased With Stay”
Reviews.Author: june480
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first vacation to Ocean City. We stayed in a first floor ocean front room for 2 nights. Our room was very clean and the bathroom looked to be newly remodeled - but quite small. We were just steps to the boardwalk and beach - both of which are kept very clean. For the money, the room was fine- you don't spend much time in it and as long as it's clean (which it was) that's all that matters. The airconditioner worked well - but was (as other people stated) in a strange place which made the bathroom freezing.....so you deal with it.......the views from the balcony were awesome and we would stay there again. The motel restaurant was good for breakfast - that was the only meal we ate there.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, rude, no iron, dirty sheets''”
Reviews.Author: beach201033838
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying that I am shocked that this motel is still open! we had to ask for towels everyday for 4 days. We were only given 3 each day for a family of four. The ones we were given were so scratchy and hard that it was painful to use on our sunburned skin. When we asked if we could have an iron we were told " the other people never bring them back we will have make some phone calls" the man who several hours later brought us a old peice of junk iron yelled at us for asking for more towels and told us that he has already been to our room once. The "cleaning" lady told us at 9am that we needed to leave our room "because she had a lot of rooms to do' and continued to stand in the doorway untill we were forced to leave.My neice had a bloody nose our first night there and the sheets were not changed but flipped around so that the stains were at the end of the bed...discusting ! When we brought this to there attention we were ignored. We witneesed our neighboring guest crossing the busy street at 12am to get more toliet paper because there was none in her room. We saw a worker using bleach and water to mop the top floor terrace and letting the water fall to the guest walking below...bleach could have gone in someone's eye. the staff complained in the elevator several times about other guests. This motel is so dirty I could not wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: amatterness
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of this hotel and was very weary about staying. When we got there we were very pleased! We traveled with two young children and the hotel was VERY clean. Pictures i've seen were showing very outdated bathrooms, but our bathroom was recently remodeled and very clean! The only problem we had while there, was the door to enter the room was very hard to unlock/open. Oceanview rooms have great views and is at a wonderful location! Staff was very nice and housekeeping didn't bother unless you needed them.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Polite, and a great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: menture1
Reviews.Content: The hotel, Sahara Tower Building, was great overall. The only bad things were that the room wasn't up to date, and the bed was impossible to sleep on. Other than that, my stay was great. It is conveniently located right next to Dunkin' Donuts and only a block away from the boardwalk. The prices were very cheap, but you got what you paid for. If your a person who is out on the boardwalk or in the pool all day, this hotel is perfect. This hotel was great in summary it was great but a little outdated. :)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: tapdanzer
Reviews.Content: My friends and I travelled to OCMD for a girl’s getaway weekend. Unfortunately, we chose to travel during one of the many "Senior Weeks" which I believe is part of the reason we had such a horrible experience at this hotel. Even giving this hotel, and its employees, the benefit of the doubt, I will never stay at the Sahara again. When we checked in, our room door was open and the TV was on. A little bizarre, but everything seemed ok in the room. We left around 8PM for and didn't return until 3:00AM. When we did return, we were on the balcony and approached by another hotel guest who was clearly underage and visibly intoxicated. The hotel security guard (and I use that term very loosely) was not worried about him, he was more concerned with us talking on the balcony. He actually said to us, "I'm not concerned with them; my only job here is to keep the noise down." The night auditor was downright rude and disrespectful when we tried to get a key to our room we had been locked out of. He kicked my friends off property and made them wait in the street while we got their car keys for them out of the room because he said they were "messing with the light [on the balcony] for 45 minutes" which was completely untrue. Then he proceeded to tell us he had eight phone calls about noise disturbance from our room. That was impossible because there was nobody in the room from 8PM until 3:00AM. Unless, of course, whoever was in our room before we checked in came back to do a little partying... Everyone with us was adults. We all hold respectable jobs and have families. We should have been the least of his worries when there were illegal activities going on in his hotel. He treated us like we were obnoxious, drunken teenagers which couldn't have been further from the truth. I have never been so poorly treated by anyone, hotel employee or otherwise. The night auditor lied to us, treated us horribly, and refused to help any of us, then kicked us off "his" property. We tried to follow up with a manager later that weekend, but none were available. I understand this is a small hotel and we are hardly going to make or break their business by not returning. But the way the Sahara employees treated us, and turned their head to underage drinking, is completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “WILL COME BACK!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl2011
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the stay! When we got there we didnt have an ocean front room, we called the front desk and they were able to fix the prroblem within a few minutes. House keeping was friendly, front desk was very helpful, parking was ok (tight spaces), pool was clean, water pressure was ok. Overall we plan on staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “we love this motel!”
Reviews.Author: DoodlebugsMom2001
Reviews.Content: We are preparing for our annual summer vacation with our small children and this will be the 5th year in a row we will stay there. This year we are taking the in laws with us and my little neice who has never seen the ocean before. We always stay in the same building the same time each year. We always have a great time and the house keeping is wonderful. The house keeping always goes the extra mile for us. The kids have a blast and our room is always clean, it doesn't cost alot to stay there so we don't go broke on the room so we can relax and do whatever we want. This year I called last week and we are arriving next week, we decided to stay an extra night, they had no problem giving us our room for an extra night. Last year a couple were drunk outside fighting, young people having a party and I called the front desk, in less then 2 minutes sercuity was there telling them to move on. I would reccomend this place to anyone. As I said this is our 5th year staying there in a row. We always look forward to our stay and we love the beach is within walking distance and the children love the pool. Everyone is helpful and friendly there.

Reviews.Title: “After getting a confirmation # over the phone - They had no room available for us when we got there!”
Reviews.Author: DenverMom001
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmation number and when we got to the Sahara we were told our reservation was for the following week but I had just spoke to them the day before and said that we would be coming tomorrow. They did not give us a room. They said they would give our money back and said that was all they could do for us. We had to drive 3 1/2 hours home that day without a room that night. I called the manager from home the next day to explain that we had a confirmation number and had prepaid for a room and when we showed up they had no room for us for the date I had asked for. The manager was not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Love the motel- great view of ocean and boardwalk very friendly and nice”
Reviews.Author: beachgrle1
Reviews.Content: During my trip to ocean city MD in August 2009 I stayed at the sahara motel located on 19th street boardwalk- It is cheaper to go towards the end of august and I got a ocean front room that faced the boardwalk and ocean really loved it, the room was clean nice updated bathroom nothing disgusting or nasty new tiled bathroom they did. and the room of course had the old brown wood boards or brown wooded walls like from the 70s but that was ok because my basement has that and didnt bother me. just letting anyone know if they dont like it. anyways the staff was friendly. will stay again

Reviews.Title: “love the location and the ocean front rooms!”
Reviews.Author: beachy52
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the sahara for at least 10 years. The rooms have always been clean. We like the private balconies in the ocean front rooms. The restaurant is great for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but worth the $$ ??”
Reviews.Author: jtrawalker
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in OC and the Sahara was recommended. The staff was friendly. I stayed in the poolside building and it was care worn to say the least. Room was clean, but probably hasnt been updated since the late 70's. They dont supply shampoo, so bring your own or walk over to the CVS nearby. Location is VERY good being on the not so crowded end of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jakiepoo
Reviews.Content: came down spur of the moment found most places were asking a couple of hundred then stopped at Sahara found staff to be nice and the room priced very reasonable. Got to the room really not bad for an older motel. housekeeper was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay will be back”
Reviews.Author: atraveler001
Reviews.Content: Have been here many times and found that for the price Sahara is the one for me. Lacation is great I like being at point on the boards, beach is clean and even though the rooms and motel are one of the older it is a great place to stay. Office staff and cleaning staff friendly and if I had a problem they were on it as soon as they could to correct it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: crabcakes
Reviews.Content: stayed 8/26 for 3 nights. check in was fine. rooms clean bathroom mopped daily. view was great. stayed oceanfront. went to fishtales while the kids went to the boards. nice restuarant not to far from motel. would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The staff needs to learn how to clean!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaDaisy
Reviews.Content: We arrived yesterday at the motel. While awaiting our room to be ready we went up to the beach. When we came back they stated our room was not ready yet it was 130. I stated i did not see anyone go in or out ( that should have been a hint right there) They checked on the room and it was finished. I opened the door and realized they did not vacuum. There was pieces of someones shoe insole all over the place. The bathroom (lost in the 60's) was not even cleaned. I am surprised they changed the sheets!! I went to the office to ask for a vacuum cleaner. The room smelled like mold/mildew I did not want my child to touch anything. We checked out after one nite. What a shame nice location lazy cleaning staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great first stay at the Sahara.”
Reviews.Author: KRS_Jr
Reviews.Content: After extensive research about where to stay in OC, I settled on the Sahara and was not disappointed. Is it the best hotel that I've ever stayed in? Not even close but for OC it sure is way up there and for the price, you can't beat it. Stayed with my wife and 3 young kids for 4 days and we had a ball. Rooms were very clean and the staff friendly. Asked for extra towels and pillows and had them in 10 minutes. I would certainly stay there again and have recommended it to everyone that I've talked to looking to go to OC. Stayed at the tower which is cheaper but is right near one of the pools and the cafe & is only half a block from the beach. Pool was clean and the cafe reasonably priced. Overall, an excellent experience and perfect for a family of 5 on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: amy48amy
Reviews.Content: The ocean front view is great. The room was clean, smelled good. No sand in the rugs or mildew smell. A/C was cold. We were far enough away from the ruckus of the night-life, but close enough to be around stores/restaurants. The walk to the rides/games wasn't bad either. Beach isn't too crowded at 19th street. Chairs/umbrella rentals right at the entrance to the beach. Parking for the Motel was close. Sahara Cafe had great breakfast til 1:45pm and it's right across the street. My only negatives were no shampoo (but plenty of soap) & the ceiling being a little thin. Some heavy-footed people were above us the last night and you could hear them stomping around. We'll stay on the 3rd floor next time :) Gentleman in the office was nice and very helpful too. Joyce at the Sahara Cafe was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vacation with the Sahara Motel”
Reviews.Author: johnnak1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sahara Motel at 19th and Baltimore at Ocean City for a few years. We stayed at this Motel again this year and as always had a good room, good value, and a great vacation at Ocean City. This motel is in a prime location for walking distance to food establishments, walking the boardwalk, churches, and near the marina for water sports. Our room was very nice with two beds and a large, newly decorates bathroom with new fixtures. everything worked fine. The desk clerk was very friendly, the rooms were very clean and our maid was great. our maid made sure the room was cleaned every day. We had a good TV with many cable channels and a small refrigerator for beverages. Our stay was quiet with good neighbors. You can't beat this motel for value. i'll be back again next year and I recommend it based upon our experience. Thank you Sahara, for another great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: lovinlifeinmichigan
Reviews.Content: For the second year in a row we stayed at the Sahara. The day before we left for our trip I checked the TA reviews and was a bit freaked out by a recent review or two about bed bugs. But NO BED BUGS in our room. The rooms are pretty standard, a bit older, with new carpet. We stayed on the second floor of the Tower Building. We like the Tower Building for t1) he slightly lower price you get over the two other buildings of the motel which are right on the boarwalk, and 2) there is a pool at the building and 3) a cafe attached to the building. We arrived at 9am on Sat. Aug 1, our room was not ready but were were able to get a parking pass to park in the motel lot and go to the beach. Our room was ready by the 2pm check in time. All was in order when we checked in. The rooms are pretty spacious, with a mini fridge and microwave. I brought my waffle maker to make breakfast in the room and sandwich and frozen things for lunches. The ice machine does cost $0.25 for a bucket of ice, which didn't bother me, but I was glad to know this ahead of time from other reviews, so I was prepared with quarters. The cafe is great. The breakfast portions are very generous. The front office staff was very friend in answering questions and giving directions to various places. We were more then satisfied and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At Sahara!!!”
Reviews.Author: NeesasMom
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from another great week at the Sahara. Our rooms were ready when we got there, and we had a great and easy check-in. We reserved 6 rooms for the week, and had nothing but great experiences. We stayed in the West building on the first floor. Rooms were clean, and after airing them out a bit (small wet smell) we were in for a treat. This place is a great location being only 1 block from the boardwalk, and within walking distance to other attractions (Embers, Mini-Golf, Laytons, Scopes). If you are looking for an upscale place, then this isn't for you. If you are looking for a place to lay your head, get a shower, and some ocean breeze that is clean and the staff is friendly, STAY AT THE SAHARA!! My family is already planning our trip for next year and we haven't even been home for 4 days yet! See you next year Sahara!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Sahara!!!”
Reviews.Author: ronnieinpa
Reviews.Content: We love the Sahara.We are a family of four (2 teenagers) and we have NEVER had issues with this motel. We get second or third floor, oceanfront. The room and bathroom were always kept clean (and I'm rather obsessive). The view is amazing whether you want to gaze out at the ocean or just people watch on the boardwalk from the balcony. Sure, it's not the Hilton, but I don't need a Hilton stay to have a good time either. As long as the location is convenient (19th St) and the room is clean, then that's what is important to me. This is a safe choice in motels...I've stayed at a few others through the years and I am back to stay with the Sahara for as long as it's there :)

Reviews.Title: “Just a Motel...No perks. General OC Info included.”
Reviews.Author: CozumelQueen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all 4 properties within this group of hotels - (BEST -Beachmark, Executive, Saraha, Tides). This was the first time at the Saraha. While the other motels are further up the beach, they are pretty much the same, but a lot cheaper in price. The further from the boardwalk you are the cheaper the motels. We rented three rooms in mid June for a family reunion. No pets are allowed at this property. All rooms are non smoking. We stayed mid-week (Tue-Thur nights) - 3rd Floor Oceanfront. The cost of each room per day was over $200. The Good - Oceanfront, on the Boardwalk - direct access to the beach. Great view - get up for a sunrise!. Rooms were clean. Nice Pillows. Parking was good. Nice balcony. Couple of clean pools. The Bad - No amenities - simple plain room. Regular Key (no keycard) - deadbolt key does not work, but deadbolt does from inside room. No elevator. No safe. Ice machine at the bottom of the stairs is 25 cents per bucket. Two beds (hard mattresses) per room, small bathroom/ shower/ sink. 2 small bars of soap. No shampoo samples, no kleenex/tissues. The tub has a pop-up drain - be sure to push it down if the water starts collecting. Air conditioning unit is right as you walk in the front door at the sink - so the sink area blocks the A/C from going further in the room unless you blast it. NO COFFEE MAKER in room. Towels - 2 small bath towels and 2 wash clothes that were like sandpaper - especially if you had a sunburn! Maid service - if you wanted it - place card outside door - if you were in your room they would ask - one day we just asked for more towels. General Notes - For the price - at least we expected a coffee maker, so we ended up going to Bed Bath & Beyond (across the bridge in the first shopping center on the right) and bought a $20 small 4-6 cup coffee maker for the room. They also had them for $10 at the Dollar General, but they were sold out. Dollar General also had Folgers Coffee filter packs (4-6 cup) and cups. Five Below (a dollar store where everything is $5 or less) is in the same shopping center and you can get boogie boards and beach umbrella's for $5. On the boardwalk - they range from $15-$30. To save money, we generally ate breakfast and lunch in our room (stopped at the local grocery store when we got there)- the refrigerator is dorm room size and a small microwave. We ate out for dinner. Restaurants - Check out the coupon books (they are everywhere (hotel lobby/grocery store) for coupons). We are from Maryland and wanted to give our out of state family members a taste of the Ocean, but did not end up getting Maryland Blue Crabs - don't be afraid - they are wonderful! Lots of work, but steamed crabs are the best! The further south you go (NC for example - they boil crabs - yuck!) If you don't want to get messy - get a lump crabcake. To please the wide variety of guests and considering cost for a family of 5 (3 teenagers). The items marked with an * are excellent. We ate at the Panda Buffet in the same shopping center one night - $12.95 all you can eat chinese buffet with snow crab legs - standard chinese buffet - nothing exciting, but good food all the same - had a $1 off coupon per person. Dough Roller Pizza on the Boardwalk the 2nd night - excellent pizza! (they also have great breakfast!) Get the sweet peppers* on your pizza! ($2 off coupon for pizza) They are awesome! Third night we ate at Sakura Japenese Steakhouse in the same shopping center as the Dollar General - Can't go wrong with Sakura - entertainment and delicious food! Price range from $20-40 - depending on what you get... full meal - soup (miso/mushroom), salad (ginger dressing), appetizer of choice (mushrooms*, shrimp* or chicken livers), plain or fried* rice (get the fried, you won't be disappointed!), grilled vegetables, choice of entree. They have combinations - steak - sirloin or filet, chicken, lobster, scallops, shrimp, salmon. (Coupon for free Ice Cream in coupon book). Next door to the Sakura restaurant is a Smith Island Cake store. Smith Island cake is a multi layer cake (very small layers {1/4"} of cake between very small layers of icing) traditionally made on Smith Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland. It is worth a try. The traditional is chocolate, but they also had other flavors such as banana nut and berry and a variety of cupcakes. We ate at the Saraha Cafe one morning - similar to a Waffle House - greasy spoon. Service was good - restaurant needs to be updated - food average tasting but large portions for the omelets, etc. There is a Dunkin Donuts one block up (towards 18th Street) on the main road. Beach - the beaches are clean - no alcohol, no pets during May- Sept. no sleeping on benches or overnight on the beach - you will get ticketed! Jellyfish in late summer/fall - beware. You can also rent chairs and umbrellas on the beach. A day trip to Assateague Island is great. It cost $3 per person to get in . Senior Citizens are free. There is a visitors center with a bathhouse (toilets, shower, dressing area) along with a small cafe/grill (hot dogs, ice cream, fries). There are wild ponies on Assateague Island that you can take pictures of - do not feed them - sometimes you can approach them but you should use caution - they have been known to bite and kick. The beach is very nice - the waves are a bit larger (beware of the undertoe - riptide on all beaches) and life guards are on duty during the day. You can also camp here, but beware of the mosquito's and the green biting flies during the summer months. The Boardwalk - starting from the inlet - there is a museum and small shops at the end as you walk up the boardwalk there are many places to shop and to eat. There are restrooms on the boardwalk every 10 blocks or so. "Playland" is one of my personal favorite arcades- they have "old time" 10 cent claw machines with "junk" toys in them - but they are a part of my childhood so each time I go to OC I have to get a cup of "junk". LOL They also have pinball machines, air hockey and photo booths. There are two places to ride carnival rides - the first is right at the inlet - tickets are 50 cents each and each ride varies from 4-8 tickets. There is also another carnival area on the pier called Jolly Roger - you can buy individual tickets or a pass. Ripley's Believe It or Not - if you are interested. Certain food items on the boardwalk are a must - Thrasher's french fries - whole potato's cut and deep fried - add malt vinegar and salt. Fisher's Popcorn - with or without nuts - awesome. Dolly's salt water taffy. Dumser dairyland - great ice cream! There are many putt-putt golf places to play on the main road and a variety of restaurants and stores as you drive further north. You can also take the bus. Not sure home much the bus fare is, but it is cheaper than parking at the inlet for the day. There is a tram you can ride for $3 each way that will take you up and down the boardwalk. You raise your hand to get off at any location. Henna tattoo's are popular, piercing, etc. Lots of teenagers/young adults during the summer. Off season I think is the best (Sept-April). Not a lot of things open but a relaxing peaceful trip. Other restaurants to try - Embers or Bonfire Buffet ($24.95+), Popular resturant's with suggestive names - Big Peckers, Bearded Clam, Purple Moose, etc. Overall our experience was good. I would have like to have eaten at a bit more upscale resturants, but with a group and a budget, its hard to do. I don't think I would stay at this property again. The reason is due to the price of the motel, yet the location is great. I prefer to stay further up the beach (90th St. +) because it is cheaper for motels. You really don't spend too much time in the rooms during the day. If you want a "nice" hotel which will be much more expensive - stay at the Princess Royale or Sheraton, Holiday Inn, Dunes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: shanstrs
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here during tropical storm hanna. We arrived very early, however we were able to get in our room right away. the people at the desk were very friendly. when we first got in our room it was fairly clean. went to the beach for the day, came back later that night, found bugs on the pillows. Not knowing what they were, we thought they were ticks(bed bugs look exactly like ticks) pulled pillow back found some more, called down to office(they thought we were joking) 2 guys came running across the street, One of them was a guy named Jake(awesome kid) as he was entering the room we had moved the mattress back only to find about a hundred of them running around. Thank god he was there to see it!!!!!!!!!!! they moved us down the hall. In the morning they refunded our money, the guy at the desk was very apologetic and understanding. Later that day saw another employee taking out bedding and I asked him if he saw them and he said no and acted like I was lying. the rest of our stay was ok. it was only after I returned home to tell my story that other people have also heard stories of bed bugs at the same place. be aware always check the seams of your mattress brown or red dots mean bed bugs. they come out at night to feed!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great; do not eat at their restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: FI413
Reviews.Content: We had the ocean view room on the third floor. The view was great; the whole wall was glass with a door to the private balcony. The room was very clean and comfortable. Small bathroom, but modern very clean. DO NOT EAT AT THE SAHARA RESTERANT. We saw the reuse of food from our own table

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: bootssnoopy
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed Mother Day weekend. We selected it because it was relative inexpensive and on the quiet end of the boardwalk. However, it is about .5 mile from the real first shopping/food and about 2 miles from the happening end of the boardwalk...lots of walking. We were oceanfront and the first night I awoke at 2 AM with wind whistling through the door crack; put down a towel and it was muted. The room had a funky mildew smell which we got used to. The A/C is blocked by the bathroom sink wall so the room was warmer on the farthest side. The room has a microwave and fridge which is great. The beds were really comfortable but only doubles so only one adult per bed. No extra bedding available in the room; two pillows, one sheet and bedspread per bed. No clock in the room. Nice TV. The motel was quiet! Slept well. The staff we encountered were friendly. The pool closes by 8 pm. Next time, I will try and stay further up the boardwalk because I have a foot disorder and it was painful after walking about 6 miles! But, if you don't mind walking (there is a tram $3 ea way), then by all means stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: luckyDadNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sahara Motel in Ocean City many times.  The rooms are very clean, the staff are very friendly and the location is great.  The pools are very nice.  The view is excellent, perfect view of the ocean.  Parking is good.  The price is terrific.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been WAY BETTER”
Reviews.Author: Lyssa21742
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 3 children booked a room (about a week in advance) for 3 days in the beach-front building with the office. Upon arrival our room had not been cleaned yet, so we waited, and waited, and waited... Once in the room, we found it to be dirty, there was an obvious wet spot on the floor, and there was enough dirt and sand in the bathroom to make a sand castle. The elevator is the size of a port-a-potty and it's difficult to fit more than two people with luggage. The beds were uber-uncomfortable and we all woke with stiff necks and tired from tossing and turning all night. The gentleman at the front desk was nice and very helpful though. No one even cleaned our room the whold time we were there! I had to call down to the office to get clean towels, and they took about an hour and a half to arrive! The view from the balcony is beautiful; I went out to take pictures in the morning and they were beautiful! But I could've gotten the same pictures from the Carousel (for just a couple hundred more dollars). Sorry, Sahara, I won't be returning! :(

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: poca1313
