Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending four days at the Sahara. The stay here was great. Its definitely not a four star hotel but it was clean and just perfect for what we needed. We had everything in walking distance...beach, boardwalk, pool, drug stores, there was a Pizza, Liquor store and pizza/sub shop in the building directly behind the hotel. The staff were super friendly, including the cleaning people and front desk. And compared to other motels, the price was cheap considering the location. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: vacationsrule4life
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I was a little worried. I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the room. We stayed ocean view and the view was not bad and much cheaper than ocean front. It is not a 5 star hotel, but if you want a nice place to sleep close to the beach, this will work just fine. I would suggest bringing your own blankets. Also have a few extra quarters for the ice machine. Overall, I would stay here again with my son. I would not bring someone here for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place! Nice price!”
Reviews.Author: 1CrazyMom
Reviews.Content: We decided to take our 2 year old son back to the beach (he loved it last year). We booked on a last minute internet special of $99 a night. Wary of such a price we only stayed 2 nights. It was a nice place, clean and seemed to be family run. The showers water pressure was the best we ever had in a hotel/motel. Coffee shop/ diner was good. Prices good to. We weren't right on the beach but 1/2 block away , but still on the boards. Nice deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER again”
Reviews.Author: jamie509
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the third floor of the poolside building from july 7-12 2008. Everyone was very friendly which was great, but the condition of the room was awful. It smelled from the minute we walked in until the day we checked out...it was a moldy odor and was just plain gross. The bathroom was the worst part though. There were spots of mold all over the floor and the floor of the shower was grey and DISGUSTING. I wore a pair of rubber flip flops everytime i showered. In fact, I wore them the entire time of my stay, even when walking around the room because I did not feel comfortable with the lack of cleanliness. Another complaint is that my boyfriend and I left for the beach at 10 am and we put the "maid please service this room" sign on the doorknob, and when we returned to the room at 2 to have lunch the room had not yet been cleaned and we had no fresh towels. We called the office and they informed us that the maids had already gone home for the day. If I am paying almost $700 for 5 nights in a skanky room, I think fresh towels aren't too much to ask for. Even if they were like 2 1/2 feet long and scratchy. The only highlight of the week was how nice everyone was. Also-our air conditioner broke on our second night and they had it replaced within 15 minutes. But i will never stay there again...or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Super Price!”
Reviews.Author: snickers34
Reviews.Content: Well I have stayed at the Sahara twice before but this is my first time in the tower building. I stayed ocean view and it was great, I stayed poolside and it was also great. And I'm happy to say the tower building is just fine as well. As I have stated in my other review, if you are looking for a 5 star palace this is not the place. It is a nice, clean, and inexpensive place to rest your head while visiting the beach. It is not the newest hotel, but for the price it can't be beat. We got the room on-line and saved even more money! There are NO bugs, bad smells, or other big issues with this hotel. It is well cleaned and well taken care of. There is a small fridge and microwave in each room. The tower building is across the street from the beach. The good thing is it is the only building with an elevator. This year I purchased one of those beach carts which was fantastic. We just put all of our items (beach bags, boogie boards, chairs, and umbrella) on the cart and rolled them across the street and onto the beach. It is not a far walk at all. I definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Those on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: WeloveOC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sahara Motel for a weekend get away with our 10 and 6 year olds. We stayed in the tower building opposite the pool. It was perfect for families on a budget. The price was right and the room was clean. The location was great, within walking distance of numerous restaurants and shops on the boardwalk. The kids loved the pools and the walk to the beach took less than five minutes. We have gotten stuck with some pretty gross and disgusting places in OC and the Sahara was one of the best motels that we have ever stayed in. Breakfast at the Sahara cafe was great, it was cheap with huge portions. This is not the place for a romantic getaway but the standard room was more than adequate for an average family who is really only in their room to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: ksj10032782
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from spending a couple of days at the Sahara Motel in Ocean City, MD. I must say that after reading most of the reviews on this site, I was incredibly nervous. After checking in, we went to our room on the third floor of the poolside building. No elevators, so it was a pretty big production to get most items in our room. The a/c and fridge didn't work. We called the front desk, and not more than 5 minutes later, someone came in to check on it, and we didn't have any more problems. We were down during senior week, but for the 3 nights we were there, we didn't hear a peep from anyone around us. Overall, if we had more money to spend on lodging in OC, we wouldn't stay there again, but for the price, $99 a night, it can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the beach”
Reviews.Author: gadibout
Reviews.Content: Stayed Memorial Day weekend for a night in the Tower building. Really noisy people drinking until the early sunrise hours of the moring next to the room. If you stay on the first floor check your windows, none of the windows were locked and two of the windows did not have locks. Other than that, room was average for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean older motel ! Great price, friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: dartoot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 27th - May 2, 2008.....We had an oceanfront room with a private balcony and an unbelievable view! Third floor room, can't remember the room number at this time, sorry! Yes this is an older motel and the bathroom was very small but it served it's purpose. The room was Spotless! Mini fridge and micro came in handy. (Tip: take along old fashioned plastic style ice cube trays, they will fit in tiny freezer section!) **Freezer section really too small to use for anything else! The weather was cold and rainy and being able to have a True Oceanfront room and balcony was great! Glad we got the OceanFront!! (Be careful in OC, not ALL hotels that claim "oceanview" are exactly truthful, you may need to be very flexible to "view" the ocean and risk hanging over the balcony railing to catch a glimpse of the water! Pictures and descriptions on websites can be VERY decieving!!) Housekeeping staff was very friendly and very efficent, fresh towels, removed trash and vacumed! We have also stayed in the West Building in summer, less $$. But reccomend OceanFront for cooler months when rain can make you want to stay in and watch the waves from your room. The price is good, OC is getting very pricey overall compared to other places..ie: VA Beach, Myrtle Beach, Topsail Isalnd and even Miami, no idea why.. so pricewise the Sahara is a great deal, esp. when considering the location of the complex on the boardwalk. Overall very happy with our stay! Hoping to return this fall!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Peaceful, Clean home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: horvy1
Reviews.Content: A very clean, family type motel located in the heart of Ocean City Maryland! The Sahara Motel complex comprises of several different buildings which tremendously adds to your total getaway experince! For those who want a direct breathtaking view of the Atlantic Ocean and Ocean City's world famous boardwalk there's the oceanfront building. So close to the ocean that you could be in the ocean in a few minutes! The boardwalk is even closer allowing you to visit several different types of clothing, beach and novelty shops. Both local and national bar and restaurants are spread throughout the boardwalk. This is personally my favorite building and where I stayed on September 30, 2007! The pool side building (complex office/front desk location) offers a little more peace and quiet from the hustle and bustle of the beach and boardwalk crowds at a little better price than the oceanfront building. A small sparkling clean swimming pool is located next to the building. Another building across Baltimore Avenue from the main office is where Sahara Motel Restaurant is located. This delightful restaurant is one of the most popular breakfast locations in Ocean City and has been around for many years, a true testament to its good reasonably priced food and excellent service. The complexes second swimming pool is located next to the restaurant. Very nice convenience! Like any room in the other three buildings, the West buliding includes pleasant, clean rooms with two double beds, air conditioning (or heating if necessary), cable TV, microwaves and small refrigerators. It also has a pretty large parking lot! Although the rates may be a little less than the other buildings you still can enjoy the all of the amenities of the other buildings on the complex! The Sahara Motel provides a very refreshing, relaxing, family getaway experience for your beach vacation experience! Rooms are clean from top to bottom and the maid service is VERY helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great view!!!”
Reviews.Author: notabeachfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the poolside building of the Sahara in July 2006 and need less to say I hated it, did not feel comfortable here at all, the room left a lot to be desired and there was too much noise coming from the pool area... On the up side, we decided to try another building because you CAN'T...WON'T beat the prices at the SAHARA... So we stayed in the OceanSide building in July 2007, much better, no noise and this building was clean... I was skeptical with the hurricane going thru there in sept of 06, but pleasantly suprised... We will be staying again this July... trying the oceanfront rooms this time, hopefully I will be just as pleased. Overall... you can not beat the location, not too far from anything... really no need to move your car from the spot. and you WON'T beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Cheap Price!!”
Reviews.Author: wmoreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept. 4-9. We had a totally pleasant experience. I was a bit skeptical after reading some of the other reviews about this hotel, but we never encountered any problems. We arrived at 9:00 AM even though check -in time was at 2:00 PM, they still let us go to our room. Maid staff was very friendly and helpful. The Sahara Cafe was very good, and a lot cheaper than most of the other restaurants in the area. They have two clean pools, which we made use of every day. Great location on the boardwalk. For the cheap price we thought it was a great place to stay. We would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: JCEMitchell
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 7 year old daughter stayed at the Sahara for a week in July. And a few weeks before we arrived I read all reviews that were very alarming. But my worries were put to rest when we arrived. The young gentlemen at the front desk was very friendly and made our check in fast and easy. We stayed in the Tower building on the third floor. The rooms were a bit dated but they were CLEAN, the chairs outside the room were nice. The maids were extremly friendly, we did not have our room cleaned all week, I did the staightening and light cleaning myself. But every morning there would be a bag full of clean towels, soap, toilet paper and paper cups. They were very friendly and helpful and they never bothered us, we did not even hear them leave the bag on our door. The pool was also clean and all the lounge chairs were great... After walking down the boardwalk and looking at other pools the Sahara was spotless. We had breakfast at the Cafe' once and it was very good and the price was just as good. It is in a great location a few steps away from the beach and boardwalk. Yet it did not have all the noise you would have when staying right on the boardwalk. I would recommend this motel to anyone who plans on visiting Ocean City. In fact we are looking forward to staying there again next year. So DO NOT listen to all those bad reviews, I am a extremly neat and like everything clean and the Sahara was just that, a bit dated but clean. And of course if you are like me you bring a can of lysol and spray the room down anyway, I would do that even if I was staying in a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton, but Great Location and a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: czang76
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time this year at the Sahara Aug. 6-10. Once again, the location is the best part of the hotel. Very convenient to walk to beach and boardwalk, but still at the quieter end of the boardwalk. Loved having the balcony and watching bikes in the morning and the crowds at night. We only moved our car once the entire trip. The rooms are a bit small and definitely dated. Our oceanfront room had water damage running down the wall and the balcony door stuck. Overall, the place is clean, maintained and safe, but very basic. No coffee pots or fancy towels or soaps in the bathrooms. But it was good enough just to sleep in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jdiegjdieg
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days at the end of June. Maid staff was very helpful and friendly. Everyone at check-in was friendly and easy to get along with. The hotel is a little older, but was clean and had everything we needed (except a coffee maker). We ate at the cafe, and the food was great, and seemed to cost a bit less than the Dough Roller and other famous places. Definitely eat there - it's worth it. (No dinner though - they closed at 2:00 - in June anyway) We used both pools - they were clean and had enough chairs, etc. Being away from the "center" of the activity was a plus - especially at night, and when we needed to drive somewhere. Dunkin Donuts and Pizza and Liquor store and Dippin Dots were all right behind our building. Oh - and the price was unbeatable! I'll stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe Sahara!”
Reviews.Author: coloradobeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there every summer since 1995. We have always found it to be CLEAN, quiet and close to attractions on the boardwalk. We love the efficiency units with a view of the ocean. Convenient parking. Always sleep well! The staff is attentive and friendly. Seem to have a genuine interest in your stay being pleasant. Love the Sahara Cafe, reasonable prices, huge portions! Good price, GREAT location! We think the Sahara Motel ROCKS! It is truly one of the BEST Motels in OC!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Excuse for a Motel”
Reviews.Author: SKI0811
Reviews.Content: June 4, 2007 We were on a Senior bus tour and what a shock to see this filthy, mold smelling room. We stayed one night and had to move to a Holiday Inn across the street for $171.00 a night for our additional 2 nights. It was worth a lot more than that to be able to breath. Ice machine broke, had to walk across busy 4 lane highway to get ice at a quarter a small bucket. No blankets in rooms, no tissues and desk gave a customer an extra roll of toilet paper to take the place of tissues. All rooms reeked of cigerettes and/or musty mold. Spraying and candles of no help. This place should be closed up for the dirt. No coffee pot. Everyone complained and will think twice before booking a trip with this travel agency.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, super location!”
Reviews.Author: ekatvi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sahara Tower Building for Labor Day weekend (yep, that's when the hurracaine was there). The hotel is old, but rooms are nice and big. There were few negative points: The building we were in was on the main street, so we could hear all the traffic noise outside. Also, we could hear people walking above us. The swimming pool is small and is facing the main street, so it is not very inviting. We haven't used it. Now positives: Location is great!!! It's in the end of the boardwalk, so you don't get any noise from there, but it is within a walking distance. There is a cafe right sownstairs that serves breakfast and lunch only and is very reasonably priced. There is also Dunkin Donuts rights across the street and few Seafood buffets within 2-3 blocks. Hotel is very reasonably priced compared to others. Overall it was a good choice and I would probably stay there again, only will ask for the room on the last floor.

Reviews.Title: “Sahara Motel Room 129”
Reviews.Author: deeperpurple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sahara Motel in August 2006. I was a bit afraid because of the reviews it got but went through with our reservation. Upon arriving in our room we noticed what looked like spiders that were killed and left to dry on all of our walls including the bathroom and on the walls behind our beds. The rooms did smell musty and were not cleaned very well. After retiring for the evening we were jolted from our beds by what seemed like a banging and vibration on our walls. We reported this to the office the next morning and the office told us it was the elevators mechanical room and too bad there was nothing they could do about it! Also, each time someone above us took a shower there was a loud cracking sound aside of our beds. Also were told too bad! IF you ever decide to stay in this motel do not stay in room 129 in the Tower Building. I feel for the amount of money we spent at this hotel we could at least have had the bugs removed from the walls and the place a bit cleaner.
